sentences: Selles külas on väga sügased juured.
context: The Estonian adjective 'sügav' means deep or profound. It can describe physical depth (like deep water), intellectual depth (profound thoughts), or emotional depth. The word changes form depending on the case and number of the noun it modifies - in these examples: sügav (nominative singular), sügane (partitive singular), and sügased (nominative plural).
